title: PSA: you will get a lower ranking after placements
body:
What? Did you think diamonds masters and challengers just magically regained their rank after placements? Of course not. They get high gold low plat. So where are the plats at? In low gold. Where are the golds at? In low silver high bronze. Where are the silvers and bronze at? You guessed it! Bronze!

So stop freaking out. Just play, have fun. And you will ryze again. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I can understand your frustration as i was once in bronze 5 myself. I can acknowledge that its the worst, most hateful place in League of Legends. 

But think of it this way: bronze is filled with the most unskilled people in league (no offense), so if you are truely as skilled as silver elo, then you should stomp most of your games and climb out easy.

Now assume you have high MMR so it takes you 3-4 games per division and then 2 promo wins. You have to play an extra 25 or so games assuming you win every single game in a row, it would take a lot of luck even for a diamond smurf to win that many in a row.

There is a large problem with your logic. You see, you are expecting those trash, as you identified them, players to actually care. Every single promotional series I have had for the last 2 seasons have been riddled with afk's, feeders, trolls, etc... I have literally gotten to my promotionals lost 2 immediately because of 2 afk's both games, and then won 2 more games which put me right back into promotionals and had another afker. I don't care how good of a solo player you are, the game is designed to prevent people from single handedly winning a game.

Don't mentally invest into your 10 placements. It's just not worth it.

Well provided you're not really low down the elo chain then placements actually do make a difference(not a crazy one, but they can). The difference is how far down you fall though. Don't expect to place up into silver from Bronze, it's not going to happen. I do need to tell you though, if you're really good enough to be in Silver...you will be. 2 seasons ago I was in your position, my placements dropped me from mid Bronze to B5 with 0 LP. Maybe you can hold your own a tier or two above where you're at, but it's time to focus on what areas you're failing at and where you can improve. That's what I had to do, and it's really payed off for me. I'm currently at high silver low gold (I haven't placed yet but I ended the pre-season at G4) and it's all because I've always thought about what mistakes I make every game and how I could have played every fight better (including fights that we win, and fights where my teammates make mistakes, there's still things I could have done better).

I understand it's really frustrating, and if you don't want to, normals are a good place where you don't have to worry about how you play. IF you want to be serious about ranked though that's the way to go about it

I've always been of the opinion that, if you are ranking players individually, than individual performance should matter. Since its hard to quantify, as you stated, what individual performance means to a match given the context and circumstances of it, I proposed a solution back in season 3 where your performance in match was compared to all players playing the same champ and role as you across all skill levels and that every action taken by you would calculate a match score rating that would be displayed at the end of the match and that this score could then be used to manipulate MMR and LP gains or loses. We basically got the first half of that, verbatim to the system I proposed, with the addition of the champion mastery system more than a year ago. Sadly, Riot chose not to include the reason I proposed this system and it does not interact with the MMR and League Systems at all. It's my hope that in the future improvements will be made to it and we may one day see it help influence MMR and LP gains and losses so that players performances can more accurately reflect their skill level more quickly. Only time will tell.

Has everyone forgot that this is a NEW season? 

Does SKT-1 get to have a game advantage in rankings simply because they won worlds last year? No. Should you be placed at Challenger/Master/Diamond just because you were in it last season? No. You have to PROVE yourself because it's a new season. Almost everything is different from last season. At the same time, should I be punished for my rank the season before? NO! This is a new season and new chance to PROVE yourself. They don't call it RANKED because they hand out free rewards. You are competing against EVERYONE in NA at this point to reach a level. 

If you win, someone has to lose. That's just the nature of the game. It's competitive and new people join while old leave. Everyone should be glad it's not like some competitive games where you literally start back at 0 (aka Bronze V) and are expected to climb all the way back up to that rank again. At least for all of us, we don't have to climb from Bronze V, we only have to climb from a division below us (usually). And for people placed in Bronze V, you should be able to climb up to your division you ended at if you really deserve that division this year.

tl;dr: This is a new season. Why should it matter where you finished last season? Everything is changed and you shouldn't get an inherit advantage in rank just because you did something when the game was different.
